  2149	def _backend_module_name(name):
  2150	    """
  2151	    Convert a backend name (either a standard backend -- "Agg", "TkAgg", ... --
  2152	    or a custom backend -- "module://...") to the corresponding module name).
  2153	    """
  2154	    return (name[9:] if name.startswith("module://")
  2155	            else "matplotlib.backends.backend_{}".format(name.lower()))

  2158	def _setup_new_guiapp():
  2159	    """
  2160	    Perform OS-dependent setup when Matplotlib creates a new GUI application.
  2161	    """
  2162	    # Windows: If not explicit app user model id has been set yet (so we're not
  2163	    # already embedded), then set it to "matplotlib", so that taskbar icons are
  2164	    # correct.
  2165	    try:
  2166	        _c_internal_utils.Win32_GetCurrentProcessExplicitAppUserModelID()
  2167	    except OSError:
  2168	        _c_internal_utils.Win32_SetCurrentProcessExplicitAppUserModelID(
  2169	            "matplotlib")

  2172	def _format_approx(number, precision):
  2173	    """
  2174	    Format the number with at most the number of decimals given as precision.
  2175	    Remove trailing zeros and possibly the decimal point.
  2176	    """
  2177	    return f'{number:.{precision}f}'.rstrip('0').rstrip('.') or '0'

  2179	
  2180	def _g_sig_digits(value, delta):
  2181	    """
  2182	    Return the number of significant digits to %g-format *value*, assuming that
  2183	    it is known with an error of *delta*.
  2184	    """
  2185	    if delta == 0:
  2186	        # delta = 0 may occur when trying to format values over a tiny range;
  2187	        # in that case, replace it by the distance to the closest float.
  2188	        delta = abs(np.spacing(value))
